page.title: 06BARNACLE VILLAGE NR.COVENTRY
page.content: {Barnacle}is a village of about 200 people.It is 2 miles east of Coventry and half a mile from the larger village of{Shilton}.The houses are{ {brick-built},and are a mixture of old cottages and newer properties.The cottages were built for{farm-labourers though{mining}and a{domestic woollen {industry}employed people in the past. Barnacle is now largely a{dormitory village for Coventry,Nuneaton and Bedworth.With{no gas}in the village,most homes are{heated}by{solid {fuel},the remainder by{oil}or {electricity}.There is a strong community spirit and a thriving village hall;while there is one public house,more organised entertainment has to be sought in the nearby centres of population.{Services}are basic:there is no school or shop;a small chapel but no church.
